Tavatron snarled softly when Dinobot leaned against her. Her own injuries, 
however, were of minor importance. The basic fact still remained, she could 
walk and Dinobot could barely stand, much less walk on his own. Either way 
she didn�t have much of a choice. He needed her in order to make it back to 
base, and she wasn�t about to just leave him there.

Tavatron sighed inwardly, she knew he didn�t like being touched, no matter 
what the circumstances may be, he had made that clear a long time ago. 
However, she wasn�t about to give up on him. She had changed, gone from a 
sparkless (heartless) uncaring �bot to one of compassion and understanding. 
That didn�t mean she expected him to go through a complete overhaul. He was 
who he was, that was part of the reason she liked being around him so much. 
Still, perhaps he could learn to show a little more... feeling. He was 
normally so cold and emotionless, quite unsettling at times.

Tavatron slowly began to walk towards the ark, wrapping her other arm around 
Dinobot�s waist, trying to offer as much support as possible. She didn�t 
mind him leaning on her, after hearing and partially seeing his shoulder 
spark she rightfully didn�t care whether or not he wanted her support. He 
was in pain, there was no denying that fact. Tavatron grimaced as she 
watched him dig into his palm again, this time, however, it seemed as if it 
was out of pain, not an uncontrollable rage. For some odd reason it bothered 
her when he did that. She didn�t know why, it just did. However, it wasn�t 
her place to say anything. Not now anyway.

Tavatron smiled to herself as the ark�s doors came into view. The important 
thing was that they were alive. A little worse for wear, but alive 
nonetheless. Tavatron chuckled softly at Dinobot�s comment. He had saved her 
life on numerous occasions, all she had ever done for him was be a burden. 
Some warrior, she could barely even hold her own in battle. The battle...

Tavatron grabbed at her back were normally her staff would have been... and 
found nothing. Tavatron groaned in frustration as she pushed open an ark 
door with her free hand. She would have to go back for it later, right now 
Dinobot needed an �R chamber:

"Seriously though, thank you for saving my life... again."

Tavatron smiled up at Dinobot. Her side was screaming with pain due to 
several if not more broken ribs, but you wouldn�t know it to look at her. 
She didn�t need an �R chamber, just some time in beast mode.
